techmeme.title: White House document: the US will tax imports of items priced up to $800 at the rate of 90% of their value, up from a planned 30%, targeting Chinese retailers (Karthikeyan Sundaram/Bloomberg)
The EU unveils its AI Continent Action Plan, seeking to compete with the US and China, and says it wants to build "AI gigafactories" with ~100K AI chips (Mauro Orru/Wall Street Journal)
Google rolls out Loss of Pulse Detection to the Pixel Watch 3 in the US after getting FDA clearance in February 2025; the feature rolled out in Europe in 2024 (Abner Li/9to5Google)
Statewatch and FOI documents: the UK government is developing a "murder prediction" tool to use personal data of those known to police to find likely killers (Vikram Dodd/The Guardian)
Ofcom opens an investigation into a pro-suicide forum, its first using the Online Safety Act; the BBC linked the unnamed forum to 50+ deaths in the UK (BBC)
